awd_titl_txt: A Sensor for Determining Viable Cell Density
awd_abstract_narration: Viable cell density is one of the                                               most important parameters in                                                    fermentation processes.  Many                                                   indirect methods of determining                                                 cell density have been introduced                                               in the past.  However, these                                                    methods suffer for non-specificity.                                             A sensor is proposed for rapid and                                              explicit measurement of viable cell                                             number density in culture media.                                                In the proposed method, viable                                                  cells are distinguished from other                                              inert particles by using the                                                    characteristics of living cells.                                                The speed in measurement is                                                     achieved by fast counting.  The                                                 sensor is usable in single cultures                                             without calibration.  Off-line as                                               well as on-line sensors are to be                                               constructed.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
